newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Oct 15.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Oct 15.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Bangladesh cabinet on Monday endorsed the draft Bankruptcy Act 1996 that proposes to bar loan defaulters from getting fresh credit until they repay past loans.
The government has approved a proposal for constituting six special election tribunals at six divisional headquarters to expedite diposal of election disputes.
A new stock exchange is going to be introduced in the southern industrial city of Khulna from January next year.
The autumn session of parliament will begin November 1.
Commerce and Industries Minister Tofael Ahmed left Dhaka on Monday on a five-day official visit to China to woo Chinese investment.
The government will constitute a commitee to look into the problems of the "sick" industries burdened with huge bank loans and shrinking domestic market.
The cabinet on Monday approved a draft Private Power Genration Policy, providing facilities of tax holiday and tax exemptions on imports to investors in power generation.
